title: Ticket #6555: Remove unneeded copies and allocations in ReliSock::put_bytes
description: Every time we all ReliSock::put_bytes, with encryption off, there's a complete unneeded malloc and copy. Let's remove that.
remarks:
2018-Feb-05 11:50:50 by jfrey:
Code Review

These changes look good.

Do casts to remove const make your skin itch? The ones here for wrap() and unwrap() are completely unnecessary. The underlying function signatures should be changed.

2018-Mar-05 09:34:01 by gthain:
The signatures of wrap and unwrap are a big mess. Sock::[un]wrap takes a const unsigned char *, for no apparent reason, put_bytes takes a const void *, authenication::wrap takes just a char *, which leads to all the casting. Let's fix this mess in another ticket.

And yes, the casting does make my skin itch.
